title: Build Sequence: PRD-001 (Part 5 of 7)
buildPhilosophy: Generated using dependency-first strategy. Each FBS represents a testable, deployable increment.

buildSequence.title: Automated Match Scoring Pipeline
buildSequence.summary: Creates automated pipeline that triggers match scoring after daily scraping completion, processes jobs in batches of 10, and provides comprehensive error handling and progress monitoring for efficient job evaluation.
testableOutcomes: System automatically initiates match scoring within 5 minutes after successful daily scraping completion
System processes exactly 10 jobs per batch with configurable wait interval between batches
System calculates match scores between 0-100 for all new jobs using skills, location, salary, and experience alignment
System continues processing remaining jobs when individual jobs fail, logging errors and marking failed jobs as 'scoring_failed'
System generates summary report after completion showing total jobs scored, failures, and processing duration
System displays real-time progress indicator with current phase and percentage completion during scoring execution

deliverables: Batch processing orchestrator with resource monitoring
Match scoring pipeline with error handling

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Must integrate with existing match scoring algorithms and handle resource management for batch processing. Requires careful coordination between scraping completion events and scoring initiation to avoid race conditions.

buildSequence.title: Advanced Circuit Breaker System
buildSequence.summary: Implements sophisticated circuit breaker pattern with failure detection, 1-hour cooldown periods, health check validation, and graceful degradation to ensure system resilience during platform unavailability.
testableOutcomes: System opens circuit breaker after exactly 3 consecutive failures and rejects subsequent requests without attempting to scrape
System enforces 1-hour cooldown period from circuit breaker opening timestamp before transitioning to half-open state
System performs lightweight health check in half-open state and closes circuit breaker on success or reopens on failure
System continues returning job search results from available platforms when some circuit breakers are open
System returns current state (closed/open/half-open) for each scraper when circuit breaker status is queried
System logs all circuit breaker state changes with timestamps and displays failure rates and availability percentages in dashboard

deliverables: State transition logging and alerting system

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires persistent state management across system restarts, careful timing for cooldown periods, and integration with existing scraping infrastructure. Must handle concurrent access to circuit breaker state and provide thread-safe operations.

buildSequence.title: Enhanced Retry & Error Handling
buildSequence.summary: Implements intelligent retry mechanisms with exponential backoff for API requests, configurable retry limits, and comprehensive error classification. Provides robust handling of transient failures while avoiding unnecessary retries for permanent errors.
testableOutcomes: First retry occurs exactly 1 second after initial failure
Retry delays follow exponential backoff pattern: 1s, 2s, 4s, 8s, 16s
Retry delays are capped at 30 seconds maximum regardless of exponential calculation
System stops retrying after exactly 3 attempts by default and returns error
Configuration changes for max retry count apply immediately without system restart
5xx server errors trigger retry mechanism with exponential backoff
4xx client errors (except 429) do not trigger any retry attempts
429 rate limit errors trigger retry mechanism with exponential backoff
Network connectivity failures trigger retry mechanism
System logs each retry attempt with attempt number, delay duration, and timestamp
Retry metrics show success rate and average retry count for monitoring
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Integrates with existing circuit breaker system. Requires careful handling of concurrent retry operations and proper resource cleanup on timeout.

buildSequence.title: Performance Monitoring & Optimization
buildSequence.summary: Establishes comprehensive performance monitoring for scraping operations and match scoring processes. Implements timeout enforcement, alerting thresholds, and performance tracking to ensure SLA compliance and proactive issue detection.
testableOutcomes: Daily scraping process completes within 60 minutes with recorded completion timestamp
Individual platform scraping operations timeout after exactly 15 minutes
System continues processing remaining platforms when one platform times out
Warning alert triggers when total scraping time exceeds 50 minutes
Warning alert triggers when any platform exceeds 12 minutes execution time
Individual job match scoring completes within 10 seconds for any job complexity
Batch processing of exactly 300 jobs completes within 50 minutes
CPU and memory usage remain within acceptable limits during 50-minute batch processing
Alert triggers when individual job scoring exceeds 10 seconds
Escalation alerts sent when batch processing exceeds 50 minutes
Historical performance data is accessible for administrator analysis

deliverables: Performance monitoring service with metrics collection
Timeout enforcement middleware for scraping operations
Alert threshold configuration and notification system

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires integration with existing logging system and careful performance measurement without impacting actual operation performance. Alert system needs proper escalation paths.

buildSequence.title: AI Performance & Dashboard Optimization
buildSequence.summary: Optimizes AI content generation performance and dashboard loading times. Implements performance monitoring for Ollama operations, efficient pagination and infinite scroll for large datasets, and ensures fast dashboard rendering within SLA requirements.
testableOutcomes: Cover letter variants generate within 90 seconds on 8GB RAM system
User receives error message with retry option when generation exceeds 90 seconds
Warning alert triggers when generation time exceeds 75 seconds
Performance degradation alert generates when memory usage exceeds 90%
Job dashboard renders complete job list within 2 seconds for 100, 500, and 1000 jobs
95% of dashboard load requests complete within 2 seconds across multiple browser sessions
Pagination controls display when more than 1000 jobs are available
Any paginated page loads within 2 seconds regardless of total dataset size
Only current page data loads from backend when using pagination with large datasets
Next batch of jobs loads within 2 seconds when scrolling near bottom with infinite scroll
Loading indicators appear and disappear smoothly without layout shifts during infinite scroll
Alerts trigger when dashboard load times exceed 2 seconds
Detailed timing breakdowns available for database query, rendering, and network components

deliverables: AI performance monitoring service with timeout handling
Optimized pagination API endpoints with configurable page sizes
Infinite scroll implementation with smooth loading states
Memory usage monitoring for AI operations
Performance analytics collection for dashboard loads
Alert system for performance threshold violations

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires careful memory management for AI operations and efficient database query optimization for large datasets. Frontend optimization must balance user experience with performance constraints.

buildSequence.title: Data Privacy & Security Compliance
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive data locality enforcement ensuring all user data (CV, preferences, applications) remains stored exclusively in local PostgreSQL database. Establishes network monitoring and validation to prevent unauthorized external data transmission while maintaining optional Claude API integration for processing.
testableOutcomes: CV upload and processing operations store data only in local PostgreSQL database with no external HTTP requests
Job search preferences save and retrieve exclusively from local database tables without external API calls
Job application data persists locally with status updates recorded only in PostgreSQL instance
Claude API integration transmits only processing data, never complete user profiles, with results stored locally
Network monitoring confirms no user data transmission to unauthorized external endpoints except Claude API
Database connection validation shows all user data queries execute against local PostgreSQL instance only
System logs demonstrate no evidence of user data transmission to unauthorized external services
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Critical security feature requiring careful validation of all data flows. Must implement comprehensive network monitoring and establish clear boundaries between local storage and optional external processing.

buildSequence.title: Memory Management & Resource Control
buildSequence.summary: Establishes comprehensive memory management system with documented allocation budgets, container-level limits, and automated monitoring with warning/critical thresholds. Implements automatic Ollama model unloading at critical memory levels to prevent system instability.
testableOutcomes: System documentation displays memory allocation budgets totaling exactly 8GB across all services
Container configurations enforce memory limits: Ollama 4GB, PostgreSQL 1GB, Chromium 1.5GB, n8n 512MB, Redis 256MB, API Server 256MB, LiteLLM 256MB, Web UI 128MB
Memory monitoring triggers warning alert when total usage reaches 6.4GB (80% threshold)
Memory monitoring triggers critical alert when total usage reaches 7.2GB (90% threshold)
Ollama model automatically unloads when memory reaches 90% threshold, increasing available memory
System memory usage below 80% maintains all services without alerts or automatic interventions
Memory alerts include current usage and percentage information for administrative action
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires careful coordination between container orchestration and monitoring systems. Auto-unload mechanism must be thoroughly tested to prevent service disruption while maintaining system stability.

buildSequence.title: LinkedIn Legal Compliance & Opt-in
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive legal compliance system for LinkedIn scraping with mandatory disclaimer, explicit consent mechanism, and opt-in disabled by default configuration. Prominently promotes email parsing as zero-risk alternative while ensuring users understand ToS violation risks.
testableOutcomes: Legal disclaimer modal blocks access to LinkedIn scraping controls until user interaction
Disclaimer displays comprehensive warning about LinkedIn Terms of Service violation risks and potential account suspension
Explicit consent checkbox with acknowledgment text prevents access until checked and confirmed
Consent timestamp records in user preferences when user provides explicit consent
New user accounts initialize with LinkedIn scraping disabled by default in all configurations
Users without consent cannot access LinkedIn scraping in job search options or automated searches
Email parsing prominently featured as recommended zero-risk alternative in all LinkedIn-related interfaces
Previously consented users bypass disclaimer but system verifies consent status on each access
System excludes LinkedIn from scraping sources when user has not provided explicit consent
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Critical legal compliance feature requiring careful UX design to ensure informed consent. Must balance legal protection with user experience while strongly promoting safer alternatives.

buildSequence.title: LinkedIn Stealth Scraping Foundation
buildSequence.summary: Establishes stealth browser automation infrastructure using Playwright with anti-detection plugins and human-like browser fingerprints. Provides foundation for undetected LinkedIn job scraping with proper stealth configuration and detection monitoring.
testableOutcomes: Playwright browser launches with playwright-extra and stealth plugin successfully loaded and configured
Browser runs in headed mode with randomized human-like user agent and viewport settings applied
LinkedIn pages load without triggering bot detection warnings or CAPTCHA challenges
Stealth plugins successfully mask automation signatures and browser fingerprints during LinkedIn navigation

deliverables: LinkedIn stealth scraper class with Playwright integration

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires careful configuration of playwright-extra stealth plugins to avoid LinkedIn's sophisticated bot detection. Must implement proper error handling for detection scenarios and maintain browser state consistency.

buildSequence.title: LinkedIn Human-like Behavior Simulation
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive human-like behavior patterns including gamma distribution timing, realistic mouse movements, variable scrolling, and business hours restrictions. Coordinates all behavior patterns to create authentic human interaction simulation.
testableOutcomes: System applies random delays between 2-8 seconds during page navigation with gamma distribution timing
Mouse movements follow realistic Bezier curves with variable speeds and random final position offsets
Scroll behavior varies distance between 100-400 pixels with random pauses every 3-7 actions
Sessions automatically terminate after randomly selected duration between 15-25 minutes
System only operates during business hours (9 AM - 6 PM) and queues operations outside these hours
95% of gamma distribution wait intervals fall between 1 and 20 seconds with mean 8 seconds
Business hours restrictions prevent weekend operations and enforce timezone-based calculations
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Complex coordination of multiple behavior patterns requires careful state management. Gamma distribution implementation must be mathematically accurate while maintaining performance. Session timing must handle graceful termination during active operations.
